module.p:
Determiners are words which can be used as the pre-specifier of a common noun –
the definite article – an (am), a’, na, nan (nam)
the possessive determiners – mo, do, a, ar, bhur (ur), an (am)
gach each, every, all There are no demonstrative determiners in Gaelic, corresponding to this/that (cat), these/those (cats). Rather, the definite article is used with a following demonstrative pronoun – an cat seo/sin/siud, na cait seo/sin/siud.
